org.semanticweb.kaon2.api
Interface ProgressListener

public interface ProgressListener

This interface receives information about the progress of various processes in KAON2. Different operations may also involve processing of several ontologies. For example, if an ontology imports another ontology, then all imported ontologies are parsed. Depenting on the type of operation, processing may involve several phases. For example, opening of an ontology may involve the phase of parsing the RDF file and then reading the axioms. The phases are documented in the documentation of the operation considered. Each phase consists of different units of work, whose completion is reported through this interface. Each completed unit is reported; it is up to the client to filter these calls (e.g., graphical representation of progress should probably be updated every couple of hundreds units of work to prevent the CPU from being clogged with repaint requests). If an operation is aborted due to an error, this is also reported through this interface.

Method Summary
 void ontologyProcessingCompleted(java.lang.String ontologyURI)
          Notifies the listener that processing of the current ontology has been completed.
 void ontologyProcessingStarted(java.lang.String ontologyURI)
          Notifies the listener that a certain ontology is about to be processed.
 void operationAborted()
          Notifies the listener that the operation has been aborted (probably due to an error).
 void operationCompleted()
          Notifies the listener that the operation has been successfully completed.
 void operationStarted()
          Notifies the listener that the operation has started.
 void phaseCompleted(java.lang.String phase)
          Notifies the listener that the current phase has been completed.
 void phaseStarted(java.lang.String phase)

          Notifies the listener that a unit of work was completed in the current phase.
 

Method Detail

operationStarted

void operationStarted()
Notifies the listener that the operation has started.

ontologyProcessingStarted

void ontologyProcessingStarted(java.lang.String ontologyURI)
Notifies the listener that a certain ontology is about to be processed.

Parameters:
ontologyURI - the URI of the ontology that is being processed

phaseStarted

void phaseStarted(java.lang.String phase)
Notifies the listener that a given phase in the operation for the current ontology is about to start. Each operation supports different phases which are documented in the operation.

Parameters:
phase - the phase that is starting

workUnitCompleted

void workUnitCompleted(int workUnitsCompleted,
                       int totalWorkUnits)
Notifies the listener that a unit of work was completed in the current phase. For some types of operations, it is possible to determine the total number of work units. If this is not possible, then -1 is passed.

Parameters:
workUnitsCompleted - the units that were already completed
totalWorkUnits - the total number of work units (-1 if the total number of units cannot be estimated)

phaseCompleted

void phaseCompleted(java.lang.String phase)
Notifies the listener that the current phase has been completed.

Parameters:
phase - the phase that has been completed

ontologyProcessingCompleted

void ontologyProcessingCompleted(java.lang.String ontologyURI)
Notifies the listener that processing of the current ontology has been completed.

Parameters:
ontologyURI - the URI of the ontology that has been processed

operationCompleted

void operationCompleted()
Notifies the listener that the operation has been successfully completed.

operationAborted

void operationAborted()
Notifies the listener that the operation has been aborted (probably due to an error).
